doc.name: mobileBuildInfo
doc.summary: Returns information about the current device.

description.overview: Use the mobileBuildInfo function to fetch information about the current device, such as the manufacturer and device name.

parameter.name: propertyInfo
parameter.description: The name of the property to be retrieved.

option.description: The name of the underlying board, like "goldfish"
The system bootloader version number.
The brand (e.g. carrier) the software is customized for, if any.
The name of the instruction set (CPU type + ABI converntion) of native code.
The name of the second instruction set (CPU type + ABI convention) of nativecode.
The name of the industrial design.
A build ID string meant for displaying to the user.
A string that uniquely identifies this build.
The name of the hardware (from the kernel command line or /proc).
The host name of the device that the current version of Android was built on.
Either a change list number, or a label like "M4-rc20".
The manufacturer of the product/hardware.
The end-user-visible name for the end product.
The name of the overall product.
The radio firmware version number.
A hardware serial number, if available.
Comma-separated tags describing the build, like "unsigned,debug".
The time, in seconds since the start of the eon.
The type of build, like "user" or "eng".
The user name of the user who built the current version of Android.

description.comments:
The mobileBuildInfo function returns information about the current device.
Property names are case sensitive.
